definition[0]: to publicly support a political group, country, or person that you agree with
example[0]: a country closely aligned with the West
example[1]: Church leaders have aligned themselves with the opposition.
definition[1]: to arrange things so that they form a line or are parallel to each other, or to be in a position that forms a line etc
example[2]: The desks were neatly aligned in rows.
example[3]: Make sure that all the holes align.
definition[2]: to organize or change something so that it has the right relationship to something else
example[4]: This policy is closely aligned with the goals of the organization.
explanation[0]: Align  is usually passive in this meaning
